name: Stream
desc: An abstract class representing a stream.

items.name: func property(forKey: Stream.PropertyKey) -> Any?
items.desc: Returns the receiver’s property for a given key.

items.name: func setProperty(Any?, forKey: Stream.PropertyKey) -> Bool
items.desc: Attempts to set the value of a given property of the receiver and returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the value is accepted by the receiver.

items.name: func schedule(in: RunLoop, forMode: RunLoop.Mode)
items.desc: Schedules the receiver on a given run loop in a given mode.

items.name: func remove(from: RunLoop, forMode: RunLoop.Mode)
items.desc: Removes the receiver from a given run loop running in a given mode.

items.name: var streamError: Error?
items.desc: Returns an NSError object representing the stream error.

items.name: enum Stream.Status
items.desc: The type declared for the constants listed in Stream Status Constants.

items.name: struct Stream.Event
items.desc: Describes the constants that may be sent to the delegate as a bit field in the second parameter of stream(_:handle:) to specify the kind of stream event.

items.name: struct StreamNetworkServiceTypeValue
items.desc: NSStream defines these string constants for specifying the service type of a stream.

items.name: struct StreamSocketSecurityLevel
items.desc: NSStream defines these string constants for specifying the secure-socket layer (SSL) security level.

items.name: struct Stream.PropertyKey
items.desc: NSStream defines these string constants as keys for accessing stream properties using property(forKey:) and setting properties with setProperty(_:forKey:):

items.name: let NSStreamSocketSSLErrorDomain: String
items.desc: The error domain used by NSError when reporting SSL errors.

items.name: let NSStreamSOCKSErrorDomain: String
items.desc: The error domain used by NSError when reporting SOCKS errors.

items.name: class func getBoundStreams(withBufferSize: Int, inputStream: AutoreleasingUnsafeMutablePointer<InputStream?>?, outputStream: AutoreleasingUnsafeMutablePointer<OutputStream?>?)
items.desc: Creates and returns by reference a bound pair of input and output streams.
